name: New York Marriott Marquis

reviews.text: Stayed for a few days, combining business and pleasure. Marriott didn't disappoint. As part of my rewards status, they upgraded our room at no charge. This place is pricey, but it's always fun to be in the heart of the action. Another great stay.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay

reviews.text: Walk out the door and you are in time square. Wonderful staff, and if you get a refurbished room, you'll have great stay. First room was on 16th floor and it was both very old and dirty. Requested a refurbished room, the next morning and was graciously accommodated. The staff was incredibly helpful, both front desk and those helping with the conference were friendly and responsive. We had a great meeting and great time.
reviews.title: Awesome location, needs to refurbish all rooms

reviews.text: After checking in and going up to my room around dinner time, I was unpleasantly surprised that the bed was unmade and empty beer bottles were on the floor. I returned to the check in desk and the staff was apologetic and upgraded me for free. The new room had a great view of Times Square, although there are probably many rooms in the hotel that do not.
reviews.title: Poor First Impression, Good Recovery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited New York on 30th Dec for New Years Eve, the hotel was booked late on and only standard rooms available. We were on the 24th floor cornner room with great views of Times Square, but not the Ball Drop view. The room was clean, spacious, very comfy bed and pillows. Bathroom a good size.
reviews.title: Simply brilliant

reviews.text: All the staff were always helpful and a superb location for times square as the police close off roads and if you are a guest at the hotel they have to let you pass, so a grteat spot to enjoy New Years eve in Times Square without queuing all day.#Masquerade Ball at the hotel sounded good but at $2000 a ticket we skipped that!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

reviews.text: The Marriott Marquis is one of the worst hotels we've stayed at and does NOT justify the price at all!
reviews.title: One of the WORST we've stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room and bathroom were small and old. The shower did not work - all the water came out of the bath tap and not the shower head. It was only fixed after 2 requests. However this did not change the fact that there was no hot water during our stay.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel
Fantastic - do not stay anywhere else in NYC
reviews.text: The sheets were dirty - it had blood stains on it the first night we got there!! The towels were also dirty - I found hairs on my bath towel (which by the way, is the mere size of two handtowels).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lights were also extremely annoying - there were no master light switch, so at night when you want to go to sleep - you'll have to manually switch off every single light in the room.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: Elevators were hopeless - had to wait for ages each time to get a lift.
reviews.title: My first trip to NYC - the Marquis helped make it great!
NY's Eve in a Ball-drop room in New York City
reviews.text: The hotel itself is pretty much just like any of the other large hotels in Times Square - Westin, W, etc. One interesting fact we discovered is that unlike the surrounding hotels, it isn't unionized! According to the 2 gents from the bell/door staff that told us this, the employees here have better attitudes as a result and "hustle" for their guests because they get to keep everything they make. I have to say, the staff WAS pretty great - friendly and helpful.

First thing about this hotel- it's BIG. Like enormous big. That's fine if you like that type of thing. The public areas are well maintained (lobby, etc.) and the rooms are in decent shape (not great - but decent). It has several restaurants - they are OK (NYC has so many great places to dine why would you eat here unless you had to?).
reviews.title: Very impressed
Great Hotel
reviews.text: The views from this hotel - those rooms that face Times Square - are fantastic as the rooms have floor to ceiling windows. This is the real selling point for this hotel. If you are interested in doing the whole NY's Eve thing, this is the way to do it in style (but be prepared to pay somewhere in the range of $1700-$2000 for that one night). We called the hotel directly - that's the ONLY way to get last-minute rooms like this one for NY Eve. Evidently each hotel holds a couple of rooms, knowing that folks like us will wait until the last minute. We were on the 17th floor which was great - could still hear the 1 million+ people outside. Security was fantastic - we never worried about this one bit (a major accomplishment given the rowdy crowds).

I was surprised that there was no mini-bar or even an in-room refrigerator (but there is a big space in the wadrobe which is designed to accomodate one?). We requested a small in-room refrigerator and were charged for it ($25 a day I think). There is a very nice fitness center overlooking the atrium and a Starbuck's in the lobby so you can get your caffeine fix in the am.
reviews.title: Simply a wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend in New York. Have previously visited new York and been disappointed with the shabbiness and smallness of hotel rooms but was very impressed with the Marriott Marquis.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Middle of Everything!

reviews.text: Very big hotel on Times Square, extremely efficient with ticket facilities for shows and tours on site
reviews.title: Perfect location for site seeing and shows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good buffet breakfast expensive at €39 with taxes and service but plenty of places around to eat otherwise
reviews.title: Great place in New York

reviews.text: Comfortable rooms with coffee maker and iron
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

reviews.text: Friendly helpful service
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: This was my second visit with my adult daughter and I would return
reviews.title: Location...

reviews.text: This hotel is the best if is your first trip to nyc (like ours) I stayed from december 26 to january 2 with my mom and we were very happy and pleased. It has the best location because you can walk to a lot of attractions and you have so many restaurants around that eating will not be a problem.
reviews.title: New Year in the Marquis!

reviews.text: We have a room in the 36th floor with a "nice view" that allow us to saw from there Times Square and part of the Hudson river. Actually, we saw part of the celebration of the ball drop from our room. Talking about the room,it was always clean and it was bigger that what we expect, even tough we ask for a double bed room, and we got a king size bed room, but it was not a big problem for us.
reviews.title: Stayed Dec 28th

reviews.text: Is not a cheap hotel, but if you are not in a budget, you can give it a try and you will be satisfies. About the elevators, we only have problems in a couple of times, but nothing to complain about it.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: If you have a reservation for the next months in the Marquis, dont worried about it. You will be fine and in a very nice hotel, and specially dont worried about the elevators. Have a nice day :-)
reviews.title: Loved it... definitely staying there again

reviews.text: Stayed here just after Christmas period, lifts for me were not a problem.. there was lots of people waiting in the holding area but you just punch in your floor and it will allocate you a lift, at peak periods the holding areas are maned if you get stuck.
reviews.title: Great Stay for New Year's Eve!

reviews.text: We visited NYC for 3 days in July. The hotel is located right on Broadway and is convenient. The elevators were not a major problem once we got used to the system, however, they were over crowded. Checking in was easy once we reached the lobby on the 8th floor. Service was excellent in the hotel as well as the stores. The Starbucks does not open until 7, so be aware if you need morning caffine. The room left MUCH to be desired. It appeared that the room needs to be updated. The air condition had difficulty cooling the room. Outside noise could be heard. Mattresses were worn and non-supportive. The TV was old. Bathroom could use a good scrubbing and the towels are worn and uncomfortable. Room service was outragous, with a carafe of coffee costing $24. As a Marriott frequent guest, I have to say that this is sub par and in need of some TLC.
reviews.title: Okay, but not worth the money.

reviews.text: Are you afraid of heights? Do you hate crowds? Do you hate waiti ng for an elevator (to take you to the lobby to register no less)? If yes, avoid this hotel.
reviews.title: Annoying elevator system

likes.disliked: — Room needed vacuming, annoying elevator system

reviews.title: elevators a hassle
reviews.text: That being said, the food was excellent, they do know how to handle crowds, and the room was in good shape.

Annoyances: the room needed vacuming, the carpet was not flush with the floor, and yes--the elevator system of this 36 story hotel was annoying (you punch in your floor and are then directed to an elevator bank).
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took 4 calls to get the floor vacumed.
reviews.title: Wrong Location, Right Location?

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Marquis before,as you cannot beat location and the rooms and service have certainly been above average. We stayed two nights this weekend, and when we checked it the room seemed in a bit of disorder. Although it was not "dirty," there were pillow cases rolled up on the dresser and I was not convinced that the room was actually turned over completely for new guests.
reviews.title: surprise surprise

reviews.text: The second night was a bit more troubling, as we hear loud voices of multiple adults from the room next door at 345am. About an hour later, when things seemed to have quieted......a young naked lady entered our room through the doors that joined the two rooms-----presumed to be locked, obviously an error! My wife greeted her with "hi"-----she said "oh my god" and quickly left through the door she entered. We presume she was looking for the bathroom in her own room, and might have been a bit impaired from partying the night.
reviews.title: Holiday vacation crowded as could be.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel management was contacted that morning, mostly to suggest they make sure adjoining room doors are locked up by the housekeepers when strangers are using such rooms---they seemed disinterested, telling us to wait in our room for a manager---a manager who never came to the room.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!

reviews.text: Very interesting.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What's bad, New York at Thanksgiving. Very crowded, service lacking.
reviews.title: Great location, okay service

reviews.text: Granted that noone goes to NYC to relax, but this is the pits.
reviews.title: State of Confusion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You arrive at the hotel, thinking you'll be in the lobby. All you see is an elevator shaft, hundreds of people and an ubiquitous Starbucks. Thoroughly depressing, if you ask me. Then you have to go up I don't know how many floors to the lobby, only to wait in a very long line for check-in. Elevators take forever, even though there are many.
reviews.title: Wonderfull Hotel !!!

reviews.text: The atmosphere is not at all welcoming. They make you feel like dirt.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent room

reviews.text: The hotel is huge and nobody ever notices you coming in or out, which some might like.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: There were actually birds flying inside the hotel, and nobody seemed the least bit upset about their welfare.
reviews.title: Well Run

reviews.text: Stayed at hotel from 7th to 10th Feb. Absolutely fabulous service. Staff were very courteous and friendly. We had previously booked the Paramount Hotel which is across the road from Marriott but after reading hundreds of terrible reviews we cancelled and booked the marriott. It was a good thing that we did change our mind as we took a peek into the Paramount while out one day and it looked shabby and has scaffolding all around it. Previous reviews of the marriott stated that there were problems with the elevators but we had no problems at all. They were very straight forward and there were hardly any queues. Only issue we had with the hotel was that we had a meal in the View Restaurant above the hotel and this was a big let down. Staff were unfriendly, food was below standard and cost was huge. I'd advise people to have meal elsewhere and then you can get a better view from empire state anyway. Overall we were very impressed with hotel and will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Best Hotel on Planet!

reviews.text: We stay at the Marriott Marquis for an annual convention in January. We've been coming to the Marquis for three years and the rooms, service, and hotel in general are consistently great!
reviews.title: The Only Place to Stay in Times Square

reviews.text: The elevators take some getting used to, but the system is wonderfully slick once you have it down. The rooms are large by NYC standards, and the hotel is really centrally located and close to many subway lines. If the weather is not too blustery, I tend to walk everywhere and love the fact that the Marquis is right smack in the center of Times Square.
reviews.title: Fabulous, fabulous experience

reviews.text: An added benefit, the Marquis is right next to the temporary TKTS booth and right across the street from the permanent booth location.
reviews.title: Personal and Business perspective review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Marriott Marquis for two nights to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. We will NEVER forget this trip!
reviews.title: Marquis was just OK

likes.liked: — The location on Times Square, near the restaurant and theatre

reviews.text: This hotel is in a wonderful location. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious (3 gals shared with no problem), elevators are fast and innovative. I highly recommend it and will stay here again. We enjoyed two of the bars, one of which has a magnificent view of Times Square. The one on top revolves. Staying in a large well-known hotel also insures that taxis are readily available and that taxi drivers bringing you back to the hotel will have no trouble finding it. The price of the room was very reasonable, as was room service, which was also prompt each day for the 5 days we were there.
reviews.title: amir salame

reviews.text: I would never have been able to afford this hotel if I hadn't found a terrific deal on TripAdvisor and then split it between myself and my girlfriends, however, it was the stay of a lifetime. The hotel was clean and our every need was attended to. I mentioned as I was checking in that I had a friend who may be stopping by and the front desk clerk took her name and asked if I would like her to have a key.
reviews.title: A VIP Feeling

reviews.text: The elevators had a great system. There was a keypad on the wall that looked like a cellphone and the elevators were named by the letters of the alphabet and arranged in a circular fashion. We were on the 34th floor, so we would walk to the keypad, push the numbers 3 and 4 and the screen would light up and tell us which elevator to go and stand beside. There was no need to push buttons on the inside and the elevators didn't stop at every floor.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel!

reviews.text: We were in the heart of the theatre district and no expense was spared to make folks feel comfortable.
reviews.title: Central location, excellent hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in a wonderful location. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious (3 gals shared with no problem), elevators are fast and innovative. I highly recommend it and will stay here again. We enjoyed two of the bars, one of which has a magnificent view of Times Square. The one on top revolves. Staying in a large well-known hotel also insures that taxis are readily available and that taxi drivers bringing you back to the hotel will have no trouble finding it. The price of the room was very reasonable, as was room service, which was also prompt each day for the 5 days we were there.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Normally prefer boutique style hotels but this is New york and the hotel was excellent. The staff were without exception super polite and efficient. The rooms, bed and bathrooms were cleaned and well stocked. It was even quiet in the room despite being on Times Square. No hesitations at all about saying how good it was. The prices of water in the room and food and drinks do match the class of hotel so be a bit careful there. Otherwise just brilliant.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived Sunday 18 November with a large party of travellers from the Uk. Check in for us was a smooth process (unfortunately some fellow travellers experienced problems as their rooms weren't ready and had to wait for the card key), however, the Hotel made up for this on departure as everyone was treated to a buffet lunch and wine.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean hotel - great beds, great views!

likes.liked: — The spacious room and the view

reviews.text: Our room was on the 24th floor (2403) and the view was fantastic, overlooking the River, looking at the map we think it was the Hudson River. The room was spacious and lovely and clean.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: We experienced no problems with the lifts whatsoever, as there is a simple system whereby you punch in your room number and you will be directed to the lift you need to take to your floor...simple. The longest we had to wait was maybe a minute or two as there were several conferences whilst we were there.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: We used the Atrium Lounge for drinks which was obviously more expensive than the bars in and around Times Square but the service was great and after a hard day of walking the bar was convenient to stop and rest our weary bodies and feet. We had a pizza one evening which again was more expensive but it was well worth the price.
reviews.title: Outstanding location but $$$ and deceiving

likes.disliked: — Too huge (you don't feel like a human in such a huge place)

reviews.text: I took my mom to NYC for her Birthday. We planned to see 5 shows in 4 days, so wanted to stay in Times Square, near the theaters. The Marriott Marquis is my mom's sentimental favorite in NYC, so although I *really* didn't want to deal with the elevators and crowds there, we booked the Marquis, because after all, it was HER weekend. I have to say that Mom, as always, was right about this place! I was pleasantly surprised with the improvements they have made to this property. They fixed the elevators, which are now all electronically coordinated so that we never had to wait more than a minute or so for an elevator. We had a large (for NYC) room on the 36th floor and had a great view of Times Square (which we paid extra for, but we thought it was worth it for the small amount of time we actually spent in the room). Super comfy beds, newly updated decor, nice bathroom with marble counterops.
reviews.title: Great location, better than expected room, good service, comfy beds!

likes.disliked: — Very crowded! But its Times Square, so what do you expect?!

reviews.text: See the Drowsy Chaperone which is playing at the Marquis theater. It is a throwback to old Broadway, where shows were just fun and meant to entertain us. No big social message...just happy and fun.
reviews.title: I love, love, love this hotel!

likes.liked: — Revolving bar at the top. And the location!
likes.disliked: — Staff have a tendancy to beg for tips - but this is commonplace throughout the whole of NYC!

reviews.text: Anyway, I'd stay at the Marquis again. Its not cheap, but conveniently located for the Theaters and easy to take the subway Times sq shuttle to Grand central station so you can catch the subway to many points in NY .
reviews.title: Great stay - Few problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi!
reviews.title: Great Location but needs some work

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. The rooms are a good size, the location is absolutely brilliant. You also have a good choice of restaurants and bars, including the revolving bar at the top of the hotel. Highly recommended. In fact, the revolving bar is brilliant! Defo spend some time up there. The restaurants are your typical hotel restaurants, i.e. not overly exciting, but you do have a few choices which always helps.
reviews.title: Generally well done for a monster-sized hotel

likes.liked: — View and size of the room

reviews.text: The bad: The parking attendants are clearly not trained in the "Marriot way" and you can expect to find a "lot full" sign posted if you are checking in on a Friday or Sat. They are experts in the NY way, which means be prepared to pay. Tip $20 bucks and a parking spot magically appears. Marriot really has to fix this as it's hurting their reputation. Full should really mean full especially when it costs $50 bucks a night already to park your beloved vehicle. I saw the parking attendants turn away an elderly couple who had driven from Canada telling them the lot was full and that they had to find another lot. It was shameful. Sending these elderly people out into a city they clearly did not know to find a garage that was 10 blocks away. They didn't even take their baggage and hold it for them.
reviews.title: Never Again for New Year

reviews.text: My other gripe is the Japanese restaurant in the lobby (8th floor). It is just awful if you want sushi. I took our friends from Kansas there our first night and the fish was not tasteful and the avocado was brown....ugh. If you must eat there order the steak. The waitstaff is pretty bad too. There are a million fabulous places to eat in NY, go find em!
reviews.title: Consistently good place to stay

likes.disliked: — Expensive bar drinks and in-room internet (though it IS New York!)

reviews.text: Marriot classifies this as a category 7 hotel but I really think only the location makes it a 7. The carpet is just hideous and the rooms could use redecorating.
reviews.title: A+ Overall

reviews.text: We travel to NYC a few times a year and do our best to avoid TS if at all possible. It's just a zoo. As is the Marriott Marquis itself.
reviews.title: Busy hotel in Zoo of a location

reviews.text: If our business or pleasure requires a mid-town location, we do our best to find a place to stay just outside the square not right in the middle of the craziness.This time however, the conference was in the hotel so we thought it would be easier.It is true that it was quite convenient to be near many subway lines but we literally be-lined directly to the subway station to just get away and spend our time elsewhere.
reviews.title: Good hotel for tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a business hotel, the MM hosts a constant flow of large conferences so I doubt there is ever a time it is not very, very busy. The staff was relatively friendly and helpful. The rooms are a decent size for NYC and it was clean and comfortable but you are merely a cog in the wheel here. The neighborhood offers only chain and overpriced dining options.
reviews.title: Exciting Hotel

reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and visit NYC from a place with personality and character.
reviews.title: Great location, but NOT a level 8 property

reviews.text: I have to confess that I selected this hotel because of its good room rates (for NYC) and proximity to the business I was visiting in the city. It is populated largely by excited vacationers enamored with the garish lights in quintessential Times Square. Its proximity to the theaters and abundance of visual stimulants are a plus - if that is what you are looking for. The hotel is surprisingly fresh - although I don't care for the prison-like theme (fence) on the corridors leading to the rooms.The room itself was pleasant (clean and well laid-out); only complaint is the slow and unreliable internet connection - kept phasing in and out despite the $20 fee/day. Friendly staff were in abundance everywhere (check-in, restaurants, communal areas) and eager to assist at every turn - huge redeeming feature in this very, very busy hotel.
reviews.title: Large hotel in Times Square if that's where you want to be!

reviews.text: We recently spent five nights at the Marriott Marquis and had a wonderful time. We were checked in by Francesco who did a great job of explaining the hotel. The elevators were no problem!! We stayed during the Thanksgiving weekend and rarely had to wait for ride.
reviews.title: Kids loved the Marriott

likes.liked: — Check out the subay entrances off Times Square- easier to travel

reviews.text: The room was great for 2 adults and 2 teens. We had two queen beds and two "easy chairs." There was plenty of room for us to move around and relax after long days exploring NYC. The beds were very comfortable and clean. Super views of Times Square and the Hudson River from the 41st floor. It rained the day of the Macy parade and after a couple hours of rain we retreated to the room. We were able to see the last of the balloons and watch parade on TV at the same time.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is in the middle of everything! Very convenient and easy to walk to many of attractions and theaters. TKTS booth located in lobby area. Cabs were easy to get at the stand under hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

likes.liked: — The large clean room and extrememly comfortable bed.

reviews.text: We think this hotel made our trip all the more special. It is more expensive than others in the area but I trust you will agree that you just can't beat the location and convenience.
reviews.title: Loved "The View"
Yada yada yada… just book it…
reviews.text: I have just returned from a 2 night stay at the Marriot and I cant rave about it enough. The location is fantastic, right in the thick of it all. The rooms were great i was travelling with my daughter and husband so we had a room with 2 double beds. I opted for a high floor with Times Square view which was amazing when i got the courage to actually look out. We ate in The View resteraunt one night and the food, staff and atmosphere was excellent, definately something you have to see. Whilst there we visited the Empire State Building which is a must, I purchased tickets online before travelling which meant we didnt have to queue. We also did the Skyride which was great fun.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Marriott Marquis on several occasions when visiting the Theater district. Its a great place to stay as far as logistics are concerned- whether you plan on staying in the immediate area or if you plan to venture out to other areas via cab or subway. As far as rates are concerned, if you book early enough, the rates are great for the value of the stay. Since the area typically generates higher fares, if you get in early the rates are very valuable.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel in the heart of Times Square NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A quick note when booking at the Marriott, request a room on the south east corridor, this will give you a fantastic view of Times Square South. See the attached picture.
reviews.title: Fantastic Bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For accommodations, the check-in/check-out, valet, in-room dining, etc. is seamless.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in New York

reviews.text: We didn't stay in the hotel but visited the bar which overlooks Times Square. We were lucky enough to get a table by the window and were there all night. Service was great and really friendly and as you can imagine the view was magnificent. I had just arrived in NYC so this was my first view of the city!
reviews.title: Very nice Marriott in the heart of Times Square

reviews.text: It's a must for anyone who visits Time Square!
reviews.title: Great stay at the center of everything
Elevators are mostly fixed!
reviews.text: I've been coming to the Marriott Marquis around the holidays for years, and this year finally convinced me they have the elevators fixed. The hotel was booked to capacity while I was there, and I never had to wait more than 2-3 minutes. In past years, I literally took the stairs after waiting for 20 minutes. As long as they are all working, (and they were when I was there), you should not worry about it.

Overall the hotel was above average in most respects. NY is an expensive place, and this is not a cheap hotel. Expect to pay more for everything. I like the Marquis because of its location and energy, as well as the points.
reviews.title: Overall good experience
Nice stay for a big hotel
reviews.text: Finally, the conceirge lounge was remodeled just a few months ago and it is fantastic. It is on the 30th floor.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: GOOD:

QUIET hotel! I was expecting it to be loud given its location but the only thing we heard was the occasional distant siren. Restaurant (Encore) was good, although a bit pricey. Rooms were roomy for New York and had good shower amenities. Beds were AWESOME. Maids were extremely polite and friendly. Hotel let us have a 2 pm checkout. Location is great - if you like touristy stuff. Within walking distance of 5th avenue shops, ice skating, all Broadway plays, restaurants, Empire State Building, Port Authority bus station ($11 shuttle to Newark Airport). Major subway stop 2 blocks away.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Lousy Elevators

reviews.text: If you told anyone that you were visiting New York and staying in Times Square/Broadway, they'd say "You lucky Devil!"
reviews.title: Marriott Marquis on Broadway

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and pleasant enough but it just didn't like up to my expectations.
reviews.title: Elevators and views all worked for me

reviews.text: Actually, for the "cheap", tacky location of Times Square/Broadway, it fit right in.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!

reviews.text: I would never have chosen this place (and I didn't, I was put up here with other business colleagues) and it was a world of difference from the last Marriott that I stayed in, in Tyson's Corner, VA, which was way, way better, as a hotel.
reviews.title: Always and excellent stay in NYC...

reviews.text: The place looked tired and my room was a hotchpotch collection of furniture that didn't quite fit.
reviews.title: The best location for Times Square

reviews.text: Some of the previous reviews stated that the elevator problems were due to be fixed in June of this year. Well, we stayed there this week, and believe me, there were nothing BUT problems. The suite we had on the top floor was fantastic, but we were actually glad to leave and go to another Marriott in a quieter location since we wasted HOURS every day trying to get in and out of the hotel. I would have gladly walked the 45 flights of stairs if I had known that each time I had to get back to my room it would take a minimum of 30 minutes to get an elevator. What's the point of being centrally located if you can't get in and our of your hotel in a timely manner? I would never stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: The elevator problem is Not overblown, it is the Worst

reviews.text: My family of four stayed here over Christmas weekend and we loved it! The rooms were surprisingly large with two comfy double beds and a large window with a partial view of times square at no additional charge. The elevator system was simple and we never waited even a minute for one. The staff was very friendly and the location can't be beat if you enjoy times square. My kids loved that Toys R Us is right across the street as well as Good Morning America. The theatres are at your doorstep, as are many great restaurants. We liked Carmines and Ollies Noodles. We walked everywhere except downtown of course, but the subway was only a few blocks away for that. Duane Reades drugstore is also nearby for inexpensive sundry items. The 8th floor has a lounge with amazing views but the drinks are a bit pricy. The only noise we ever heard from our room on the 11th floor was an occasional siren. I would definately stay here again, in fact after seeing in person the location of some of the other hotels, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Bravo Marriott Marquis!

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel with my family as a group of 6 from 13th December for 4 nights, and we were quite worried with regard to the comments regarding the elevator situation mentioned in previous guest comments. Fortunately this proved to be unfounded and they seem to have sorted things out, as and we never waited more that a minute or so for the lift to arrive, even though it was peak holiday time.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Alright, this hotel was very good in some ways, but bad in others. Lets start with the bad. The hotel is extremely large and seems to be an epicentre for what is going on in Times Square. If you like to be in the middle of things, this hotel is fantastic, but if not, it is very crowded. It can be near impossible to get a lift up to your room from the street level because of the hundreds of people trying to get to the times square shows under the hotel. With it being a large hotel, I was suprised to discover the lack of restauraunts. There was one marriott cafe that closed at 8:30 (NOT HELPFUL, especially after wanting as much time out in NY as possible) and an extremely over priced show case restauraunt on top of the hotel, that revolved around in useless circles so that you could see NY, but really you could see nothing. The food served there was probably worth a quarter of the price charged, and had EXTREMELY slow service, which the waiter gave me attitude about and blamed in on another large group. Needless to say, I am an Australian and am not used to leaving tips at the best of times, so this guy was not going well. After that "experience" I left a very small tip and never went back. Be careful as they try to pull the trick of putting an AUTOMATIC 18%!!!!!!! surcharge on the bill if u have more than 4 people. We had 5, so the $500 bill for the trash we ate went up t0 590. Rediculous! Moving on. Being a large hotel, service was lacking slightly, and it took a long time to get anything. Putting that aside, it was a top quality Marriott. The room I stayed in was newly furnished, with new TV and had a fantastic view over times square. Saying that, LOCATION LOCATION BABY!!!! This hotel is fantastc. Right in the middle of everything, walk out the door and Times Square just hits you. A great place. So, to wrap it up. A busy hotel, but to expected in Times Square, bad food in typical marriott fashion, but a irreplacable location and a great room. It definately was an experience I will never forget.
reviews.title: An "Experience"

likes.disliked: — Service, so many people in the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, the staff is knowledgeable and helpful, and the rooms are impeccable in cleanliness and comfort. As everything is with NYC, everything comes with a steep price tag, $7 for a bottle of water, but if you're on vacation, this centrally located hotel is well worth the money. It should actually be a 4 star rated hotel instead of a 3.5. Kudos to the staff and management for being on point, organized, and friendly.
reviews.title: Beautiful times square hotel

likes.liked: — Comfortable rooms and overall hotel ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Marriott Marquis before a 10 day Canada/New England Cruise. The hotel has a great location and is in walking distance to Cental Park as well. The room was comfortable. We stayed on the 32 floor with a nice view of the city and part of Times Square. The service was great. The bed comfortable and the bathroom a nice size. The tv was new and had a great picture. I would stay here again if in the area. I would say that I like staying in the Central Park area a little better over the hustle and bustle of Times Square.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Marriott Marquis

reviews.text: we stayed for 4 nights. had a king room on the 22nd floor looking right down onto times square - great! the room was huge, really comfy bed and sheets, cant fault the room at all. i did queue for 10 mins to check in as there was only 1 member of staff on duty (it was midnight) and when we came to check out, we left the bags in the room (having been assured that they would be brought down to left luggge) but when we returned 4 hours later, they were still in the room. To their credit, the situation was rectified immediately. 2 sour points on anotherwise perfect stay. Oh, other than the $9 bottle of stella in the hotel bar, with the barman not even offering to give me the $1 change from my $10 note - rather pricey by any standards.... So it gets a 4 out of 5, i would have gone for 4.5 out of 5 given the option. But given the price (£250 per room per nignt), you expect the best , with no excuses. I thoroughly recommend this place, great location too!
reviews.title: Blissful room, service lacking somewhat

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel two years ago and had a great experience. So, this year when I checked the rates ($500/night) I thought – well, it’s REALLY expensive, but it’s worth it.
reviews.title: OK but not great - I was surprized
Great stay!
reviews.text: I attend a Convention for a week every January and have stayed at a lot of hotels in Times Square. Of all of the hotels I've stayed in, I prefer the Marriott Marquis. The rooms are much bigger than others in the same area, the fitness center is free, the elevators are efficient (now that they've finally finished renovating them), and the staff is nice. Plus, the beds and pillows are really comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are visiting Times Square, the Marriott is right in the middle of everything. But if you're there on business, you'll find that the hotel has a nice lounge on the eighth floor for an after-dinner drink, two Starbucks (first floor and eighth floor) for that morning cup of coffee, and is pretty quiet considering it's a huge hotel right in the middle of New York.
reviews.title: Luxory in the heart of planet Earth
Amazing Marquis
reviews.text: When we checked into this hotel we were given a room with a

reviews.title: Another good review
reviews.text: times square view even though we didn't request it! We stayed on the 28th floor and the room was nice. It was agreat stay.

reviews.title: Amazing Hotel
reviews.text: Just spent 4 nights at the Marriott Marquis and have nothing special to add to the other happy campers. It is a fabulous hotel, very large rooms, absolutely no problem with elevator delays, maybe those reviewers didn't know how to use the keypad. The longest we waited (twice in four days) was 2 or 3 minutes. Most times an elevator arrived in less than 20 seconds. Friendly, courteous staff, spotlessly clean, nice bedding and toiletries. We were part of a business group, and several of those who tried the hotel food were not impressed, especially the breakfast. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't offer our personal opinion. The table service in the Atrium Lounge (bar) was deadly slow, though.

reviews.title: King of Times Square
reviews.text: Fantastic location if you like being in the Times Square action, we were on Floor 17 and could still hear the sirens, horns, etc, but not enough to keep us awake.

reviews.title: STAY AWAY!
reviews.text: If you are planning to visit the Guggenheim, wait until after June 27th. The outside AND inside is under construction for a special exhibit and there are only 2 small side galleries open, not worth looking at.

Over the years I have heard not so great things about the Marriott Marquis and so when I was block booked here with some colleagues I wasnt wildly happy. However, rumours are sometimes just that and I must say I was pleasantly suprised. The room cost was favourable to competitors and the experience enjoyable. The rooms are a good size with Sofa, chair and a very comfortable bed. One little niggle and for the second time in a row in new york, my bathroom still had the hair of the previous guest in the bath - but they were very apologetic and it was cleaned again within 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Suprisingly good

reviews.text: I would recommend this for a times square option with space and a good facilities.
reviews.title: great location in an incredible city!!

reviews.text: Stayed here just on a quick overnight tagging along with a friend & her son who works in the city. The location can't be beat, right in the center of the action with easy subway access to lower manhattan & uptown, and times square right out the door!
reviews.title: Excelent stay

reviews.text: We had a lovely view of times square on the 25th fl....ditto the previous reviews on the quiet & great, comfortable beds....i agree on the oddity of the bathroom door situation but the nifty under the counter nite lite made up for it!! Service was top shelf, folks at every corner to explain the elevator situation...the workout room had a fab view & if you bring your headphones you have a private tv screen if the view bores you.
reviews.title: Trip to Big Apple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned back to the Uk following a three night stay at the Marriott Marquis, everything was perfectfrom the moment we checked into the hotel, very polite reception and porterage staff, we were in our rooms within a couple of minutes. The bedrooms were very clean and well appointed with all the extras available as standard, bed s were the most comfortable of any hotel I have stayed in throughout the world, with fresh linen daily. The food was very varied in the hotel would suggest the excellent views from the Buffet Restaurant on the 48 th Floor. The food on the 8th Floor restaurant both for Breakfast and Dinner was of a 5. star standard the staff were outstanding. We have enjoyed the hotel that have already rebooked to return in November 2007. The hotel is ideal for Broadway and we could hear very little noise from our rooms on the 22 nd Floor. Thank s for a great holiday
reviews.title: Central
Nice if you can get a good rate
reviews.text: I work in MidTown about 2 or 3 times per month, and I stay here because it is centrally located. The hotel is clean, but big, so the lobby gets crowded in the evening. The rooms are nice, although the 45th floor (top floor) is rather noisy because of all of the mechanical equipment up there (air conditioning, etc.)

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: I feel that at over $300/night, hotels in New York are pricey, but like others say, it is in Times Square, and very convenient for me. The one thing that is way too pricey? Internet access. It is now $16.95! And that is for 3,000Kb/upload and 300Kb/download. I am lucky to be able to charge this cost back to my customer, but if you are watching your costs on your trip to New York, just be aware.
Overall, very nice hotel, good service, great location.
reviews.title: Nice Digs in Time Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at the Marriott Marquis. This hotel is in a great location! The elevator system was very efficient. The hotel was at capacity but we never waited more than a minute for an elevator. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious on the 45th floor and had a great view of Times Square. As for the TV we had a 40 LCD. This is a very nice hotel but definitely not a luxury property.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For breakfast we recommend Junior's directly across the street on 45th. The food was excellent, prices reasonable, and service quick.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was luxorious and had quite the view of Times Square. The bed was appointed in the finest quality linens and down pillows and comforters. My husband booked a romance package that included strawberries and champagne in the room upon arrival and a dinner at the rotating restaraunt. The strawberries and champage were top quality and so was the food at the restaraunt. The restaraunt staff were polite and courteous in reconciling an error on our dinner bill. The food selection and taste were impecable.
reviews.title: Amazing!

likes.disliked: — The noise from the Atrium Bar in the evenings

reviews.title: What a trip!!!
reviews.text: The room and bathroom were spotless. As for the location, what can I say? You are in the most exciting location on Earth. The possibilities are endless surrounding this hotel.

We stayed at the Marriott Marquis for five nights for our first wedding anniversary. We originally wanted to have a beach holiday but opted for something different and certainly weren't disappointed! We were lucky enough to have a view of Times Square from our window with the Empire State appearing in the background - fantastic. The lifts (or elevators) were brilliant and we never had to wait. The staff were always helpful and courteous and the maid left our room spotless each day. If you stay at the MM you must have drinks in The View Lounge on the 47th floor - the ride up there is an experience in itself. The drinks are expensive when compared to other bars around Times Square but it is THE only place where you get a 360 degree view of Times Square whilst enjoying a drink or two.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: I don't know where to begin. Stayed for 4 nights right before Christmas. Was there with another family and we all had a great experience. The location was superb. Times Square was literally right outside our window. The subway was right around the corner, the cab rides were not expensive to go almost anywhere because it was so centrally located. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing that took time was getting our luggage out of holding from the concierge when we were leaving. But there were lots of people leaving at the same time, so it wasn't from them not trying. The rooms were very clean, and extremely comfortable, and very large for a NYC hotel room. The elevators were very quick. The fitness center was great. The taxi line outside was usually long, so we just hailed our own taxi on the street and had no problems. The staff was always helpful,and friendly. The day we were leaving was the subway strike and the cabs were charging $10 a person to go anywhere. So when we were trying to get to Penn Station 12 blocks away, they were trying to charge us $60 to get there and the bellhop guy at the Marquis was negotiating with the cab drivers and got us one for $25. All the employees were more than willing to help. I have stayed in many NYC hotels in many parts of the city, and many were higher priced than this one, but this is definately the top of our list for where we will stay next year.
reviews.title: Be Young and Fit...
Best Xmas!!
reviews.text: Chose this hotel due to prime location in Times Square for New Years Eve. I made an extra effort to note the elevator service due to previous reviews on this site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK. Very big and nice room. Clean and had everything needed and service was good. However, the place doesn't have any charm. Just a very big and busy hotel. The location is indeed close to many of the things we wanted to see and do, but after a long day walking around the city and seeing the sights I would have preferred a quieter and more relaxing place to stay.
reviews.title: OK, but not great

likes.liked: — Nice big room with a great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unbelievable stay, we stayed here as the first part of our honeymoon and it was amazing. Without a doubt 3 of the best days of our lives.
reviews.title: Best hotel in the world!!

reviews.text: Firstly the location is amazing, you step out and Times Square just hits you. Everything is fairry close although some areas you would need to get a taxi to but we decided to walk to most of the places especially the great shops which my wife loved (wonder why!!).
reviews.title: huge
great hotel
reviews.text: The service was topnotch, always helpful and respectful throughout our stay and they met all our needs.The restaurants were beautiful too with lots of choice. I'm sure anyone would be spoilt for choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visually the hotel is amazing, lifts were fast and eye catching. Room was beautifully decorated and very spacious.
reviews.title: A great first NYC experience

reviews.text: I am generally not a fan of huge chain hotels - and this definitely is one, but a great choice in NYC. Rooms were large for the city, excellent views, fresh feeling finishes. The only negative of the room is the beds are very small - if you are sharing with friends they better be close friends! Also the hotel decor is definitely not my taste. The location simply cannot be beat, we had a great stay.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Marriott Marquis due to its proximity to shops & public transport. We had a great view of times square from our room, though I am sure after a week the lights & noise may get a bit uch. We stayed 3 nights, to finish off our trip in New York. the elevators at first seem quite daunting, until you get the hang of it. the central atrium of the hotel was really awesome, hope fellow travellers do not have a fear of heights! The room was clean, however I felt the room was bland & nothing spectacular. However I cannot fault the hotel's great location, or the lovely staff, even at 2am check-out (due to very early flight!)
reviews.title: Great location, great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to stay at this hotel in the heart of Times Square to celebrate a special occasion. We knew the price would be expensive, but we were able to take advantage of the senior rate. There is a special check in line for elite members, which we took advantage of. Check in is on the 8th floor, as are some restaurants, shops, and lounges. We checked in the week after New Year's eve, and there was absolutely no wait. As soon as we arrived we were attended to by a check in associate, who was friendly and cordial. We mentioned our special occasion and asked if a room with a view was available. We were given a king room on the 36th floor overlooking Times Square....Wow, what a view!!! The room was a good size, clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable as were the six pillows provided. There were black out drapes, which were very efficient at blocking out the lights from Times Square and the room was dark at night and surprisingly quiet considering the hotel location. The elevator system in the hotel is very efficient...you punch in the floor you want to go to on a central keypad, and it tells you which of several elevators to get on, each identified with a letter of the alphabet. Most of the elevators are glass ones, and you get a terrific view of the inside of the hotel as you rise or lower. This is a huge hotel with 1,600 rooms and very impressive. The View lounge and restaurant on the 48th floor rotates with great views of NYC. To access the View, you have to take the elevator to the 3rd floor and change elevators to take a special one that goes directly up to the "View" location. Not a problem at all. They offer a restaurant and also a buffet or just drinks. Needless to say, it's pricey! Also, an $8 cover charge after 8pm. There are plenty of good restaurants right down the street on 46th, between 8th and 9th Ave. (restaurant row), which we took advantage of at more reasonable prices. We did have breakfast one day in the restaurant on the 8th floor, which was pricey with slow service. That was disappointing. Overall, considering the location and the view (which is fabulous), the hotel was very good, and we were glad we stayed here at least once, but would probably opt for a less expensive alternative in any future stay here.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed here 5 nights over the New Year's holiday. I've always wanted to be in Times Square on New Year's Eve! It was an experience to say the least. We were very impressed how The Marriott staff let only hotel guests in, as you had to show your room key. ALL of the staff were extremely nice and helpful. Leighton at the check in desk definitely went the extra mile and provided 5 star service! He help to make our stay here unforgettable! With the elevator system they have, we didn't have to wait for an elevator for more than a minute, which shocked us, as the hotel is huge!!!You are walking distance to so many theatre's, restaurants, etc. We hope to stay here again!!!
reviews.title: Perfect location, we will stay here again.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. We booked through New York City Vacation Package Deals, which I also recommend.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Contrary to other reviews I had an especially good experience. Everybody seems obcessed about the elevators which I found to be very efficient with little time waiting for them(at most 3-4 minutes at peak time) My room was wonderful and the bed was fabulous. The bathroom was very nice. The room itself was quite comfortable and was of average size. I found the staff very helpful and courteous. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel since I had read the same comments from Trip Advisor. No, it is not a Sofitel(which I have stayed in), but it is a very nice, big, well run hotel. I would definitely stay here anytime and would recommend it to anybody that is not used to spending $700 a night for a hotel.
reviews.title: Very pleasant

reviews.text: I feel compelled to write as we also stayed here in November, the service, attention detail, lifts were first class, at no time at all did we wait for a lift. All the staff were polite and verey informative. We asked for a Times Square view and got one and had a wonderfully comfortable room. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone. Location is fantastic. The bars and the View restaurant in the hotel first class. This was our first visit to New York from England and the hotel made our trip. We have been to Vegas 3 times and this hotel easy compares to the likes of Caesars Palace etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Wouldn't stay anywhere else

reviews.text: For our 4th stay in the Big Apple my wife picked the Marquis.We loved it,the View restaurant was very good and the location was just perfect.The lifts(elevators) were slow but maximum wait was only about 6 minutes,our room had a poor view but it is posssible to pay extra for a room with a view of Times Square.The fitness room is very good and I would consider staying here again.It would be great if all the rooms had a nice view but I would recommend it to friends etc.
reviews.title: Well we liked it
This must be the worst hotel in New York
reviews.text: The level of service here (I write from my very-much run-down room) sets a new low standard. Try calling reception, or the concierge.....50 rings....no answer. Try taking an elevator.......you MAY get one today. The rooms are old and tired. For over $500 a night this is an absolute travesty.

reviews.title: Repunzel Repunzel
reviews.text: The recently opened club 49 has commandeered one of the elevators in what is already an inadequate system. We found very few elevators working. the crowds would build withing the holding area as the same letter would be given to all. Asthetically it is a beautiful system, and had it been built to just shuttle guests, it might have been adiquate, however with the various clubs, restaurants, theaters, shops, catering facilities, and gawkers we were frustrated to no end... like Rupunzel being held prisoner on the 33 floor while our dinner reservations slipped away..

reviews.title: Excellent Stay
reviews.text: And speaking of the Club 49....We inquired about it and were enticed to go up. at first we were on the fence until she offered to dicount the cover by half on on the girls and free for the guys. It was still too much..Sit in the lounge on the 8th floor and watch groups of people ride up and the previous group escaping back down. The view is fantastic but the sparsely populated club was way too loud and occupied by gangter rappers grinding up against their "companions"
Everything else about the experience was excellent, fortunatley you dont need to go to the club with so much to offer in NY...but the elevators are a deal breaker for me.
reviews.title: enjoyed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am confused on the reviews here. After our stay, I was sure to come here and find bad reviews. We went for five days the week prior to Christmas and here is what we experienced.
reviews.title: Guess we went on a bad week????
Times Square
reviews.text: We checked in around noon and were told we could check in and get a lower level room on the 8th floor, or wait and get one on the 49th. We decided to wait four hours and get a higher room. After checking our bags in and walking around the city in our traveling clothes (from Tampa, FL) we returned to find they were giving us the room on the 8th floor. After speaking w/ management we were offered on on the 34th which was fine. The room was a nice size- a little larger than the standard. The bed was VERY comfortable, but there was a layer of dust on the back of the toilet and the tissue box was disgusting. It had toothpaste spray all over the side and dust all over the top. YUCK! My husband always checks the waters b/c we have been charged many times for the person before us opening them and filling w/ tap water. Of course, this had already been done (ALWAYS CHECK THIS!) and we called the front desk immediately so we would not be charged. We left the room and came back two hours later which is when the guy had JUST come to the room to replace the waters. When we rec'd our bill days later, we were charged for the waters we called about! However, it was taken off our bill with a simple visit to the front desk. We were also charged a $15 room service fee for the guy to bring us new ones.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent w/ the subway close and all shows and good food close. I HIGHLY recomment John's pizza around the corner in the old church- yummy!
reviews.title: Great location-don't spend money on upgraded corner room.

reviews.text: Concierge was hit or miss. I would either get someone extremely informative and polite, or I got an attitude that they thought they were better than me and how dare I ask them a question. There was a spanish girl w/ med lenght hair that was polite every single time and remembered me. And I always tipped.
reviews.title: Still amazing

likes.disliked: — Price is high. But then again, any nice place in NYC is expensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also noticed they do not answer the phone with "Good evening Mr. Kilpatrick how may I help you?" as they did years ago. I missed that and thought it gave it a personal touch.
reviews.title: Just perfect for the occasion...

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Marriott Marquis once or twice a year for the last 10 years or so, and despite the crush of the holiday travel season, the hotel service was the best it's been in awhile. The room is very spacious for New York. We always request a small refrigerator for the room, and sometimes we have to wait awhile for it....but not this time! A very nice lady set it up for us. The bell captain was very good, gave us his card, and the incoming luggage service was excellent. Leaving the hotel, the luggage service was a little slower, but it was at 12 noon and the whole world was checking out! I also noticed that the elevators were extremely quick and you hardly had to wait for one. The bellman told me that the entire elevator system was overhauled...well it really does make a difference! What's also great about the Marquis is the 8th floor, where you can always go for a stroll any time day or night, and enjoy all the views and have a drink, look in the shops, or get a coffee. Great stay, great location....see you soon!
reviews.title: Still great after all these years!

reviews.text: Old - Betiful view - Go there if you do not know NY....it's central
reviews.title: It' OK for NY standards....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in New York Marriott Marquis for a week in March. We had a room on the 45th floor with a stunning view of Times Square. The room was spacious, modern and very clean and the elevator system was fantastic.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: But it was location that made our stay in NYC. There is actually no better hotel than this – you can’t get any closer to Time Square.
reviews.title: Great Room, Terrible Executive Loungs

reviews.text: We were quite pleased with our stay overall. If only there was no internet charge and better service.
reviews.title: Perfect New Year's Eve Vantage Point!

reviews.text: Stayed here in Jan 07. What a fantastic location. Right in the heart of Time Square. The main lobby bar is cool, and the revolving bar on the top floor has amazing views - well worth a beer!!
reviews.title: It dont get more central than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were average for a Marriott - i.e. clean but not overly modern or anything. Price wise - $240 for a night - cheap compared to London!!
reviews.title: Marriott Marquis in New York - The Heart of Big Apple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you visiting New York for a night or 2, I would well recommend the Mariott Marquis
reviews.title: loved the marquis!!
fantastic hotel - pinklady Trinidad
reviews.text: After staying at the Renaissance Times Square 4 years ago, my wife and I decided to try the Marriott Marquis on Times Square for a week-end without the kids... Overall, this is a great hotel, on New-York standards, I guess. The lobby is breathtaking, check-in is efficient and fast. Negative: the rooms are dark, very dark... No separate WC from the bathroom (diff between a nice bathroom and a great bathroom), no luxury, just efficiency. TV is rather old and remote is almost a guess game when you want to use it. The position of the hotel in the heart of the heart of New York ie. Times Square, is exceptional. Walking distance from Central Park and only 4 miles to Battery Park. No need to say that you can do some sightseeing from there without car. Back to the hotel: Broadway Lounge with outstanding view on Times Square (8th floor). Breakfast restaurant (Encore) a bit too crowdy. Then, a restaurant with class: The View. 46th floor, reservation needed, express elevator with amazing view of the lobby on the way up. Problem is: they don't chek the reservation before alowing people to board the lift, so you end up queuing on the top, waiting to be seated. Favor the tables on the outside of this revolving restaurant, otherwise, you won't enjoy the view at all. Meals ar correct, but surely don't deserve the comparison with other restaurants, like the Asiate for instance.

In conclusion, above average for the location, the lobby, the view and the elevators. Average for the rooms. Now, let's be fair... when we get back to the Big Apple, it's likely that we'll book this hotel again, though....
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!
Great stay @ Marriott Marquis!
reviews.text: Booked 4 nights stay at this hotel sometime in January and got a real good rate. Liked that the hotel was in the middle of theatre district and very close to the theatre we went to. Close to a lot of good restaurants like Sardi's, Juniors, Carmines, Bubba Gump Shrimp. Close to Good Morning America, Virgin Megastore, the heart of Times Square.

reviews.title: Good New York experience
reviews.text: Beds were smalller than usual double bed but we made do. As long as it was clean and comfortable, we were happy.

reviews.title: Doesn't disappoint. but oh those elevators
reviews.text: We just got back from two nights at the Marriott Marquis in New York to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. We stayed at the Marquis using reward points. You cannot beat the location of the Marquis, settled right in between the two "Y" intersections at Times Square. Everything you could possibly want within walking distance (we even walked there from Grand Central Station. we took train in from CT rather than fighting NY traffic). The staff was very helpful and friendly, the front desk, the concierge desk, the security staff, the concierge lounge staff and even housekeeping... we always got a have a nice day and enjoy your day from everyone we passed in a Marriott uniform. The previous review complained about the decor, it was a normal hotel decor, most Marriott decors are the same but who cares you are in New York City you should not be saddled in your room worrying about what decade the decor came from!!

reviews.title: Total disappointment
reviews.text: Our view was fabulous, right over the North side of Times Square looking right at all the flashy billboards, fun to look at at night, and although they were so bright that it always looked like daylight we just shut the curtains and that took care of that.... it was surprisingly quiet in our room on the 30th floor, we thought for sure we would hear hustle and bustle all night but it was very quiet...... only complaint about room was that the windows are in need of a washing, not an easy task in New York City I am sure...

reviews.title: Perfect for my family
reviews.text: One complaint I have was the ticket booth (which I don't think is even part of Marriott, the box offices just happen to have a window in the Marriott) the people there were not very friendly, they did not even seem to want to help us... our questions were pretty much just ignored as the people at the desk joked amongst themselves, we had better luck going right up to the individual theatre box offices... on thrusday and friday nights we just walked up and down Broadway to the box offices and on Thursday night we walked up to the window of "Rent" at 8:00 (showtime) and got 8th row tickets for half price and on friday afternoon we walked up to the box office at "Phantom of the Opera" around 4:00 and got front row center tickets (actor had just handed them in).... so if you just want to wing it and not picky

One last comment to make is that the beds at the MM are so comfortable - we honestly haven't slept that well in a long time! We will certainly be returning to New York at some point in the not too distant future and look forward to staying at the MM again.
reviews.title: My sixth stay at the Marquis-Just keeps getting better!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came to New York all the way from sunny Edinburgh - Scotland for my 40th birthday, MM was fantastic, the whole hotel was always immaculate and the staff were falling over themselves to be helpful. The room was spacious, beds a little too soft for my liking but the linen felt very luxurious on my poor tired feet at the end of a night. Towels could have been a bit bigger, but again soft and fluffy with a feel of decadence about them! Had read reviews before coming about problems with the waiting time on the lifts - never experienced it at all, the lift in itself was an experience - very fast and a bit gut wrenching as you reached the bottom floor, but all added to the fun. Excellent location for walking to everything in Manhattan and right beside the Times Square city tours bus stop as well, the down town loop trip is fabulous with fantastic entertainment from the tour guides. Would recommend the Marquis Marriott to everyone and anyone, already looking forward to my next trip!
reviews.title: New Years Eve at the Marriott Marquis

likes.liked: — The view from our room and the location.

reviews.text: The location was prime- close enough to the heart of Manhattan to walk, minus excessive noise often associated with staying in the middle of it all. The rooms were luxurious and spacious, and the view was lovely. The in-room bathrooms are large and have lots of counter space. The beds were soft and comfortable, and the sheets were above adequate. The eighth floor has nice, clean bathrooms, lots of benches and chairs to rest in, and includes one of the hotel's two Starbucks. Even if one is not staying, I recommend giving the Marquis' eighth floor a visit. The only downside is the odd elevator system- it's quite confusing at first and the ride may frighten or alarm some guests, but it's an all-around exquisite hotel.
reviews.title: Beauty, Convenience, and Location

reviews.text: Stayed there for about one week in May. The price we paid was competitive ($260) for such a Hotel in NYC, as part of a conference concessionary fee. We had a very large room on the 10th floor. The room looked towards a side-street of Times Square, but Times Square could be seen from the room. In short, we had excellent view for a price less than the one that would be charged for a front room. The reservations of the hotel should be commended on this, as well as the front desk.
reviews.title: Very good Hotel, very good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was extremely smooth, check-out pretty much the same. The room was very large, to the standards expected from Marriott, and there was no noise at all - either from outside or from the atrium.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited the hotel bar a couple of times, and the service was excellent, including the fact that it was one of the few bars I have been where they know how to make real cocktail Manhattan!
reviews.title: What a view from the restaurant!

reviews.text: A reservation I may have has to do with rooms in higher floors. I happened to visit one such room (I think it was 23rd floor) and there was no much light or view (because of the way the hotel is built). However, this does not have to do with the hotel service, which was excellent in every respect.
reviews.title: decent hotel, fabulous customer service

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights, at the end of February, up on the 35th floor, overlooking Times Square.
reviews.title: Towering Above Times Square

reviews.text: There were four of us, and the room was a little small, BUT, the location was everything.
reviews.title: Gorgeous and Convenient

reviews.text: We were in the heart of the city; and we walked almost everywhere; taking cabs occasionally to save time.
reviews.title: Nice location; Somewhat decent conference hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lifts were flawless; a little busy at times, but what do you expect in one of the busiest cities in the world.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The staff were helpful and friendly; no complaints there.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Having stayed at Marriott hotels all over the world, for the value and alternatives available nearby, I would not recommend the Marriott Marquis.
reviews.title: $500 a night for a Marriott, this must be New York

reviews.text: Cab Fare: $30 from LaGuardia
reviews.title: Chistmas in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Location
reviews.title: Great Hotel in center of Times Square

reviews.text: Cons: Price, Standard Room Amenities, Hard to get into and out of
reviews.title: Great location - Poor service & Facilities Outdated

reviews.text: This is a massive hotel on Broadway with over 40 floors of rooms. Just getting checking-in is a challenge. The lobby is on the 8th floor and the Marriott's elevator system is confusingly high-tech. If you arrive early, I got to the hotel around 1 PM, expect to wait. Fortunately I am a Platinum member of Marriott Rewards to they found a suite for me when I checked-in. The room, though massive, was a pretty standard Marriott hotel room. The view, though I was on a high floor, was of another skyscraper. So there was nothing particularly special about this hotel. No upgraded bathroom amenities like a separate shower and tub. There was an iPod playing alarm clock, if that counts as special.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marriott Marquis is a very nice hotel. Service was excellent.
reviews.title: Marriott Marquis

reviews.text: Food in the Encore restaurant was very good, pricey, but this is NYC! Elevators are not as bad as people say. Yes there maybe a wait time, but not as confusing as some are saying. We had a big dance convention there the two days we were there and the elevators were busy but never waited more than 5 minutes. The hotel has 15 high speed elevators and 40 stories, so I don't think that is a long wait time. It can get very busy at the street level with Starbucks and the Theatre queue right outside. Valet's were great for hailing us a cab and everyone was very friendly. We would definetly stay here again.
reviews.title: Greatly improved from previous stay

likes.disliked: — Internet access was expensive and unreliable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the MM twice before, and when my company booked us there for a large convention recently, my reaction was, well, unprintable. How wrong I was. Upon check-in I was greeted in line by a staff member who asked how my day was and assured me that I'd be taken care of right away (which I was; I was the only one in line!). My room was very large by NYC standards (but not all are at the MM), and was very clean and well-appointed. It's a huge hotel, and at times feels like it. The massive bar/lounge in the lobby is pretty intimate for its size (and the service can be quite slow, even if they aren't busy). The best thing about this visit (and the worst thing about previous visits) was the operation of the dozen or so elevators that had to get everyone to one of the 45 or so floors. They have computerized them now so the waits are minimal, and you only stop at a few floors on your way up (no matter how far up you go). Kudos to Marriott for taking this behemoth, inpersonable hotel and turning it into one of their best.
reviews.title: GREAT location, great hotel

likes.liked: — Felt like a Las Vegas huge hotel

reviews.text: This is a very pricey hotel, but you truly get what you pay for. There were very helpful staff members waiting to assist with our luggage when we arrived and check-in was no problem. The hotel is huge, and though it was clearly busy, we never heard any noise from other rooms, the hallway, or times square ,when sleeping. The rooms are very large with very impressive views.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Elevators a NIGHTMARE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is incredibly convenient. You are located directly amid the Broadway shows and Times Square.
reviews.title: Had a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was thoroughly impressed with my stay at the NY Marriott Marquis. My wife and I stayed two nights, a Friday and Saturday. These are two of the busiest days of the week at this property and our stay went off w/o a hitch. From our check in experience, where the gentleman checking us in accomodated our request for an upgraded room , to the hotel staff guiding us through the process of catching the elevator. The room was a beatiful suite, and was very large. It was very clean and appealing. Some of the furniture appeared a little worn, and some items appeared dusty, but nothing unusual. I contacted the front desk on a few occassions to ask questions about local calls and even info on the show we were going to see, and they were very pleasant and courteous. The housekeeping and turndown service were good, and overall I do not have a single negative thing to say about the service the staff provided. I have read some reviews regarding the wait for the elevator, and I can say we never waited more than 3 minutes for an elevator( even right after the shows let out).
reviews.title: First Rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the line to get in to the View restaurant elevator was outrageous. We did not sample any of the in-house dining or bar options, well because NY is aleady expensive and the Marquis doesn't buck the system when it comes to affordability. My biggest pet peave is the charge for internet service. I travel quite regularly , and I have grown accustomed to the free internet most of the hotels I stay in provide. When you are playing "tourist" the internet has replaced the fodors guide as the best tool for navigating a city, and to go without or fork over $17/ day is aggravating for a $400/ night room.
reviews.title: Excellent View of Times Square

reviews.text: Check-in was efficient and friendly. Our room was not ready for early check-in but the porters quickly took care of our bags and we were off to see the city. It was an easy walk to the UN on a beautiful day. After the UN tour our room was ready. It was on the 31st floor, large with a sitting area, and aview of Time Square. The concierge lounge was on the floor below where we went for late afternoon snacks which could have easily turned into dinner. The next two mornings we had breakfast in the lounge while looking down on the city bustling below.
