We stayed using Marriott Reward points but the concierge rooms and lounge would have been worth it even if we'd been paying cash.
reviews.title: Small but clean room, great bed!

likes.liked: — Comfy bed and proximity to Penn Station

reviews.text: The elevators that some people seem to find a problem were very efficient. In a hotel as large as the Marquis we really appreciated being able to go directly between floors without multiple stops as happens in most elevators. Other than our ears popping when we sped from the 1st floor to the 31st floor nonstop we were delighted with the experience and wished more large hotels installed a similar system.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: It was a bit disappointing that the hotel was unable to grant my request for checkin two hours early (4 pm is the normal checkin time), but I was quite pleased once I got into the room. The beds had high quality linens and a down comforter, and the firmess of the mattress was also adjustable. Bathroom was clean but the heatlamp was ineffective so I had a chilly shower the next morning. A great array of toiletries, including a mini mesh sponge! The thermometer was a bit tricky to operate, because even though I set it at 73, it would blast cold air into the room to maintain the temperature, so it would get very cold every hour or so. The price I found at Travelocity.com was $50 less than advertised on the hotel's website, so i was quite pleased overall. Plus, the hotel is a convenient 2-minute walk to Penn station and located at hte corner of a nice little plaza that included the Manhattan Mall and lots of eateries. I'd definitely go back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in the Heart of Times Square

likes.disliked: — Crowds in lobby and ground floor level

reviews.text: I do not understand how this hotel gets some of the poor ratings I have seen on this site. We flew up to see the Color Purple and Wicked. First, we arrived on Friday at about 3 pm. We didn't have any trouble with the elevators. If one can read, one should be able to operate the elevators in the Marriott. We could see where they had recently completed some renovations. The first thing I thought as we went up the elevator was how much this hotel reminded me of the JW Marriott in San Francisco. When we arrived on the 8th floor to check in we queued for all of 3 minutes. We had 2 rooms and in a flash we were on our way to our rooms. Everywhere we turned in this hotel we were offered assistance. Our rooms were beautiful and clean. The beds were beyond comfortable. Plenty of good towels. Good water pressure in the shower. Check out was a breeze. We did so much shopping that we decided to ship what we bought back home. Not a problem. We called, "At your service" and a gentleman came up boxed up our purchases and off he went. We received the items in 3 days. I will note that I thought the security at the Crowne Plaza up the street was better than at the Marriott. At the Crowne one cannot get on the elevators without showing your room key. The other thing I will note is that the food was so expensive. I wasn't feeling well after the flight, and I ordered room service. I ordered a turkey sandwich, baked potato and small bottled water. The cost was over $31. That even seemed expensive for me by NYC standards. All in all I enjoyed my stay at the Marriott and would stay again anytime.
reviews.title: As usual a great Marriott Stay!

likes.liked: — Convenient to Broadway Theatres, shopping and great food

reviews.text: This hotel is quite amazing - 2000 rooms over 40 floors. The problem is that it feels as though you are staying in a shopping mall. It lacks personal service and the rooms are particularly tired for a hotel of this star rating - the towels particularly were so old, rough and discoloured. There are no mini-bars in the room and the furniture is scratched - the rooms are very dark. We went up to the revolving restaurant at the top of the hotel, which was offering a vast buffet - we didn't taste the food, but the ambiance was more 3* with most people not adhering to the smart dress code. The lobby of the hotel is amassed with people trying to get theatre tickets for Broadway shows and you certainly don't feel relaxed when you get back from a great day in the City. It's too big, too hectic, too many people and lacks a personal touch. Sadly disappointed.
reviews.title: Not a great escape!

reviews.text: I stayed here on the strength of recommendations from others on this site and because of price, but I have to say I will honestly never stay in this hotel again. Firstly the queues at Reception upon my arrival AND my departure were awful. I queued for over 20 minutes each time while not all desks were open and I watched reception staff standing behind closed desks at reception chatting and drinking coffee. Views were ok - I was on the 29th floor. However, I smoke 30 a day and the smoking room I was given was truly dissgusting - and that's from me. The walls were yellow and the stink in the room made me feel ill (and this never bothers me - and I stay in hotels over 100 nights a year always in smoking rooms). The room I found very small - we were only there one night so we had 3 adults in one kingsize room: 2 in the king bed and 1 on the sofa bed (which was made iwth dirty sheets and had to be changed!) - and when that was out you could not move in the room. I honestly will never stay in this hotel again. The only positive thing I can say was that the shower was fantastic and the bathroom products fantastic. I wish I could give a more balanced review, but on this occasion I cannot. On another note, business centre is very expensive ($8 for 15 mins online I was charged).
reviews.title: I would never stay there again! It was awful!

reviews.text: I have read your reviews since Jan '06. This site helped me make my decision on which hotel I should stay at. I am very thankful to Tripadvisor for providing this GREAT service.
reviews.title: Everyone should stay here!

likes.liked: — Comfort of the rooms; Cleanliness of the place; the friendly, efficient staff.

reviews.text: 1. The hotel is perfectly located on Time Sqaure and REAL close to most, if not all of the Broadway Theatres.
reviews.title: So So experience

reviews.text: This was the most amazing trip i have ever taken. I had never been to NYC, booked myself, my sister and my best friend from indiana for a girl's weekend.
reviews.title: NEW YORK NEW YORK!!!!

likes.liked: — the location and the chocolate covered pretzels on our pillows-totally unexpected
likes.disliked: — the blowing of the whistles for taxi calling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The elevators were awesome...can't understand why some people don't understand the system....NEVER had to wait for an elevator. Starbucks right in the hotel, PIZZA everywhere, I recommend Lombardi's, John's and Bella Vita. City streets were clean, subway was clean and not at all scary. We ventured some distance on the side streets as well and never feared for our safety in any part of town.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is prime for theatre junkies....I was a peace on Broadway! We explored as much of the city as we could in 3 1/2 days. We wil be back when the WTC memorial park is finished. The city blocks are very short in distance, so even if you have to walk several blocks, you don't log much distance.
reviews.title: Tourist Location

likes.disliked: — Elevator broke for 3 hours and we climbed 17 stories twice!

reviews.text: The staff was amazing...the cocolate covered pretzels that were on our pillows the first night were amazing. LOVED this hotel, worth every penny we spent to stay there, and will definitely book there again.
reviews.title: Great location; glad I was expensing it for work

likes.liked: — Surprisingly quiet for a large downtown NYC hotel.

reviews.text: Wear your walking shoes...it is an amazing experience...not one that I would take young chidren on, though. Unless you plan activities accordingly....then i would take them.....but I'm glad I didn't take them on my first trip to the city!
reviews.title: What a location!

likes.liked: — Great size room with wonderful view

reviews.text: My stay at the Marriott Marquis was only a one-night stay while I was in NYC for a vendor conference. The hotel was only about a 10 minute walk up 7th street from Penn Station. Once you enter the hotel, you actually have to take the elevator up to the 8th floor, as that is where the hotel lobby is actually located. Signage was good and I had no issue realizing this as soon as I walked in. This is a large hotel as you might expect, there were a bank of elevators supporting it. This is the first time I've seen this though where you actually enter the floor number you want to go to outside of the elevator and the system tells you which elevator to then proceed to. This was different but I actually really liked it. Don't try to jump another elevator though because it may not be stopping at your floor and there are no buttons inside the elevator to select which floors it will stop at!
reviews.title: Great location...great hotel!!

reviews.text: The check-in process was quick and easy. Fortunately there was no line and I walked right up and showed my credit card and ID and just like that, I was on my way to my room, which was located up on the 15th floor. Signage was good as I walked off the elevator and I was able to easily find my room. I was a little upset when I arrived to my room to find that someone had left trash outside my door. Once inside, I was presented with a nice modern room that was actually larger than what I was expecting. Most other NYC hotel rooms I've stayed in have been on the smaller side.
reviews.title: Good, Central Hotel in NYC

reviews.text: My room was equipped with a king sized bed, a work area, small love seat, a couple of chairs, a small coffee table, two night stands, and a dresser with 6 drawers. On top of the dresser sat a HDTV. For premium channels, it's just HBO and unfortunately it did not support the LodgeNet app, which allows you to control the TV using your mobile device rather than the remote. The room was also equipped with a large safe, coffee station, iron, ironing board, luggage rack, and a full-length mirror (it's actually behind the bathroom door and easy to miss). Bathroom was clear and good sized. It's a combo bath/shower with a curving shower curtain rod so you don't feel quite as cramped when you are taking a shower. Another thing I liked was that the top half of the shower curtain was see thru, which also helps with the overall openness feeling of the shower area. There is also a nice sitting/shelf area inside the tub where you can place your shampoos, razors, etc., or for women, they could sit there and shave their legs. There was plenty of countertop space on the bathroom sink to lay out items if you like.
reviews.title: Perfect Location. Average Room.

reviews.text: The work area sits next to the dresser/TV area. There are four easily accessible outlets and an Ethernet cable for Internet access. The hotel does also offer WiFi in the guest rooms, but neither the WiFi or the wired Internet access was free. It is frustrating when you pay these kind of room rates that Internet access is not included. At the end of the day, I just wound up using my cellular connection on my devices to access the Internet. What I really liked about the work area is that there is a shorter desk underneath the main desk that you can pull out and use as well. I actually thought the main desk was a little high for typing, so I pulled out the desk underneath and sat my devices on it and it worked out great. I also found the high back chair to be comfortable while I worked.
reviews.title: Great location in the theatre district.

reviews.text: If you are like me, you need a couple of outlets near the bed, and I find this often very difficult at most hotels. I'm happy to say that this was not the case here. The one end table had two outlets right on top for me to use. There was also an iHome alarm clock radio on the night stand as well, and if your iOS device uses the 30-pin connector, then you can dock your device. Otherwise, be sure you have a convertor for that Lightning connector! As for the bed itself, I found it to be comfortable, although the mattress was a bit on the soft side and I prefer a firmer mattress. That being said, I didn't wake up with a sore back like I have at other hotels.
reviews.title: Times Square Anniversary
Big Hotel, Big Price
reviews.text: You can't get any more smack in the middle of Times Square than this. If you like a big, big hotel with lots of hub-bub you'll love the Marriott Marquis in Times Square. The Broadway Lounge on the lobby level looks over Times Square and is a fun place to have a drink even if you're not staying there. The staff was courteous and helpful on all levels. The business center has complimentary computer access to print boarding passes. I had stayed here once before when the elevators were a nightmare, but no more - I never waited more than 30 seconds for an elevator no matter what time of day. Personally, I prefer a smaller, quieter hotel, but I stayed there on business and it was convenient to where I needed to be and I received a special rate through the show I was attending - but it was still very expensive. The rooms no longer have mini-bars, but I requested an extra ice bucket to keep a couple things cold. It was slightly inconvenient to have to refill the ice each morning & evening (would have been more so if I'd not been reasonably close to the ice machine). I was in room 1656 which was large and comfortably appointed; the bed was comfortable. On a minor note, the bathroom did not have a magnifying mirror - a nice accessory I have come to appreciate. The biggest drawback was that the walls were thin and I had noisy neighbors - on both sides - each night. I could literally understand conversations.

reviews.title: nice but overpriced....!
reviews.text: Being a new yorker all my life, and now living in tampa for the last 4 years... it was a 'STICKER PRICE' shock of how expensive hotels are in the big apple. I was there for a conference for two nights... just a standard room on the 41st. floor, no breakast included, no free bottle of water, price $479 a night.... no kidding. the hotel is a typical marriott, just that it is in times square/theatre district. The hotel is very clean and the very big. The exercise room is state of the art and really nice if you like to work out.. the hotel staff are friendly... (like all new yorkers including myself are!! :) ). The open atrium is very nice with the glass elevators whizzing up and down. keep your eyes open you will probably see someone famous....!

reviews.title: In the heart of TImes Square
reviews.text: We were there for a conference. Our room was nice and wasn't loud like you would expect being in Times Sqare. The workout center was great. Lots of equipment and you can borrow headphones if you forget yours.

reviews.title: Enjoyed the Stay
reviews.text: Currently the place where you buy the discount tickets for plays is on the street by the Marriott so it does get a little crowded when you walk out and there are tons of people waiting in line and you have to get through them.

reviews.title: Right in the Middle of the Hustle and Bustle of NYC
reviews.text: The hotel was convenient to everything and overall we enjoyed our stay.

reviews.title: Perfect location for first time visitor
reviews.text: Stayed here 28th May - 2nd June 08.

reviews.title: Decent
reviews.text: Firstly elevators...Never had to wait more than a few minutes for one. Very easy to use (type in your floor number and it directs you to which elevator to use). Yes it does get busier at Peak times (when people are leaving for theatres around 7.30pm) but still wait was minimal.

reviews.title: One problem after another with our reservation - handicapped travelers beware!
reviews.text: Location – Great for the first time visitor (as we were) Right in the hub of everything. And walkable to most tourist locations…ESB, TOTR, Central Park etc. Only time we got a taxi was to Battery Park for the Staten Island Ferry and South Street Seaport.

reviews.title: Great location in NYC
reviews.text: Room. Perfect size. 33rd floor, view of times square. We had 2 rooms both with 2 queen beds, ample room for storage of clothes and also of cases (handy to keep them open to start storage of all the things you are going to buy). 2 chairs and table beside floor to ceiling window which gave great views over times square.

reviews.title: Is it Worth !!!!!!
reviews.text: Iron and board plus hairdryer where supplied. Toiletries were changed every day (even if there were not used) We seemed to get different makes of shower gel, shampoo etc every day even though we did not use it).

Having never stayed in a Marriott before, and not expecting much we were pleasantly surprised. My husband and I took our three daughters for one night because my husband had a business meeting very early the next meeting. We had 2 connecting rooms. Usually our hotels of preference when staying in NYC are W Hotels. The meeting was at the Marriott Marquis so we thought this would be easiest. Check in was a breeze. We were suppose to have one king room and one with double beds. We were told we had 2 doubles. No problem This was quickly corrected. The rooms were clean and bigger than we are used to when staying in the city. At around 10 at night I called the "at your service" button for down pillows, which came right up. I also called for toothbrushes which were delivered promptly as well. After the meeting my family had breakfast in the hotel restaurant which, believe it or not, was delicious. With good rates, service, and cleanliness we will remember the Marriott Marquis before the Ws.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

likes.liked: — The Service and Location - Times Square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing is, next time we will travel with our pillows. Even the down ones were a bit hard on the head.
reviews.title: Loved the Marriott Marquis!!!

reviews.text: We reserved the "Romance Package". Loved it!!!!! Our room had a Times Square View... amazing. The champagne delivered to the room was a great touch.. The View Restaurant was wonderful.. the food was very good.. the service was excellent.. and of course the view was Amazing!!!
reviews.title: Wow ! - Times Square On New Year's Eve

reviews.text: The staff at the Marquis made the stay very easy. After we went to see the tree, we didn't leave the hotel again.. There was NO charge at the gym. open 24 hrs very nice.. most hotels charge you..
reviews.title: Location...Location...Location

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone.. very nice time.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.text: if times square is your location this hotel is perfect
reviews.title: best location in Times Square
Impressive!
reviews.text: big rooms can have 3 beds without beeing crowded

I've been to NY many times and nearly always stayed somewhere different. My favourite is probably the Waldorf Astoria but that went downhill after Hilton took over (although I understand it's now on the way back up). I found the Marquis on my very first stay whilst based at another hotel and back in those days the broadway lounge was a revolving bar. Today it's static, still with a great view, but I'll never understand why they introduced a revolving restaurant on the top floor of the hotel from which you can't actually see Times Square! I've recommended this hotel to friends and colleagues so I decided to give it a go myself this time and I have mixed feelings. It's in a great location and you really feel the buzz of NYC staying here. The rooms are modern and large which is another bonus in this town. They come with a coffee maker (also rare) and huge flat screen TVs. Good amenities and two Starbucks in the hotel plus a theatre ticket desk and even it's own theatre....so it pretty much has everything you need in shopping trip to the Big Apple. However, it's a massive hotel so it lacks character, the elevator system has been designed to cope (although some people don't like it, I thought it was fine) and, except for one concierge who was really helpful, the staff weren't that great. If you want the personal touch stay somewhere else but if you want bright lights, big city, this just might work for you.
reviews.title: If you want the buzz of NYC....stay here!

likes.liked: — Location, Starbucks on site, Large rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is an excellent location, with great views from some of its rooms, but you can have this in other hotels in the area without have to stand in an overcrowed hotel, unpersonal and unsafe: anybody can use the elevators from the ground floor to the the rest of floors. As the reception is in the 8th floor, nobody check who is taking the elevators to go to the teather inside the bulding, to the restaurant in the higher floor or...to your own floor and room....It is a really unsafe place.
reviews.title: Unsafe Hotel. I can not recommend it.

reviews.text: Choose another hotel in the area
reviews.title: Its sooo NYC!!

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Marriott Marquis for 3 nights as the base for our shopping trip. We knew from previous trips that the location would be good but the whole experience was in fact excellent. Friendly staff, nice spacious room with 2 double beds guaranteed at time of booking. Good facilities withing hotel, including very good gym...if you have that much energy...good luck!
reviews.title: Loved it! Clean and in the middle of Times Square!

reviews.text: Easy access to attractions, shops, ticket booth for Broadway shows and subway. An excellent all round stay.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in December to see some shows and do some shopping. The location couldn't be better for seeing shows, it is on Times Square and there are about 10 theatres within five minutes' walk. Disney's new show The Little Mermaid is right next door (AMAZING show by the way, really really recommend it to adults and kids alike).
reviews.title: Average apart from the location

likes.disliked: — nothing really... I suppose the room could have been a little lighter

reviews.text: Our room, 2803, was unremarkable. It was a little dark due to the small window and the shape of the building, but had been recently refurnished so the bed and chairs were comfortable, also new carpet and curtains. The bathroom was fine, there was a coffee maker, no minibar but two bottles of expensive water, the TV was not a plasma / LCD but an old-style CRT, perhaps it varies depending on room / price paid. The room was extremely clean and smelt fresh.
reviews.title: Too big

reviews.text: The lifts were good, we didn't wait longer than 30secs while we were there and once you were in they moved very quickly with few stops. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, but Junior's across on 45th was absolutely fine, quick service and good food as others have suggested.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Marquis

reviews.text: We ate room service late one night when we were too tired to go out; food was good and delivered quickly, costing $80 for two soups / burgers / sodas.
reviews.title: Convenient Hotel

likes.disliked: — Extremelly long line in the front desk and even bigger in the restaurant.

reviews.text: The public areas were well maintained and the few staff we spoke to were friendly and helpful. There was an extensive fitness area which we passed by but didn't use.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was great, but the roomservice was very poor. We ordered the Clam Chowder and the Nachos, and they were both really bad. Make sure you do not eat at just any restaurant in Times Square. That is where we had our most expensive and worst tasting meal. Check reviews online for restaurants, and for the same price and/or less, you can have some of the best dining in the world.
reviews.title: Elegant room, great location, but poor roomservice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a room at the Marquis during the third weekend of March 2006 for the first time. I found a great rate at $199 and took advantage of a great deal. First of all, this hotel is in the middle of Times Square, the middle of everything, fast paced, the typical NYC hustle and bustle. If you dont like crowds..stay somewhere else. If you are impatient..stay somehwhere else. If you dont like elevators..stay somehwere else.
reviews.title: Excellent stay..Staying here again!
I Loved This Hotel!
reviews.text: Ok, the important info:

The room was clean and large compared to others I have stayed at in NYC. The bathroom including tub and toilet were clean, the bed linen was clean, the conceirge was friendly ( even though the lobby area was packed with people, they still took the time to patiently answer our questions ) check in was easy but is located on the third floor, the elevators gave us no problem, overall, this is a great place to stay. Shop around for good rates. I would recommend this hotel for all types from singles, couples, families, etc. Have fun, it's NYC!
reviews.title: Impressive place

reviews.text: This hotel has everything you could possibly want! I absolutely loved it. It is located directly across the street from the Minskoff Theatre and Juniors (famous for their cheesecake). It is in walking distance to Central Park, Trump International Hotel and Tower, Bad Boy Entertainment Worldwide, and the starting point for tour buses. The glass elevators move between floors so fast that you think you are on a ride in an amusement park. I loved it! The View restaurant on the top floor is awesome. Well, the view from the restaurant is awesome; the buffet is terrible. If you don't mind paying $30/person for cold food, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, don't eat the buffet! It's not worth the money. Valet parking is $50/night. There is a parking garage directly across the street (next to Juniors) that is a lot less expensive. Enjoy! This is a fabulous place to stay. And it's worth every penny!
reviews.title: Great Stay!

aka: New York Marriott Marquis Hotel New York City
description: Perfect for business & leisure travel, this world-class NYC hotel is located in the Times Square theater district of Manhattan and features newly renovated hotel rooms, event venues and restaurants.
